page.title: 05LIFESTYLES OF RIPPINGALE
page.content: Due to mechanisation,{few people {remain in agriculture}but commute to towns;thereby forcing agricultural wages to compete with other trades. Women,who would once have worked on the land,now try to find alternative jobs to fit in with domestic arrangements.{Greater affluence}means an increase in home ownership,larger houses,possession of private transport and consumer products.Town dwellers often move into villages,buy average priced houses and balance the loss of population caused by a lower birth rate.Because of{centralisation of {community services}and the decline of public transport, it is felt that, although we have a better standard of living,the quality of life is often lower.To counteract this,an effort is being made to revitalise the Church and other village activities.
